verses.text: There \w is|strong="H3426"\w* an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* which I have \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, and it \add is\add* \w common|strong="H7227"\w* among \w men|strong="H0120"\w*:

A \w man|strong="H0376"\w* to whom \w God|strong="H0430"\w* hath \w given|strong="H5414"\w* \w riches|strong="H6239"\w*, \w wealth|strong="H5233"\w*, and \w honour|strong="H3519"\w*, so that he \w wanteth|strong="H2638"\w* nothing for his \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* of all that he \w desireth|strong="H0183"\w*, yet \w God|strong="H0430"\w* giveth him not \w power|strong="H7980"\w* to \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* thereof, but a \w stranger|strong="H0376"\w* \w eateth|strong="H0398"\w* it: this \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*, and it \add is\add* an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w disease|strong="H2483"\w*.

¶ If a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w beget|strong="H3205"\w* an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \add children\add*, and \w live|strong="H2421"\w* \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w*, so that the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w years|strong="H8141"\w* be \w many|strong="H7227"\w*, and his \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* be not \w filled|strong="H7646"\w* with \w good|strong="H2896"\w*, and also \add that\add* he have no \w burial|strong="H6900"\w*; I \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, \add that\add* an untimely \w birth|strong="H5309"\w* \add is\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* than he.

For he \w cometh|strong="H0935"\w* in with \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*, and \w departeth|strong="H3212"\w* in \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w*, and his \w name|strong="H8034"\w* shall be \w covered|strong="H3680"\w* with \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w*.

Moreover he hath not \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, nor \w known|strong="H3045"\w* \add any thing:\add* \w this|strong="H2088"\w* hath more \w rest|strong="H5183"\w* \w than|strong="H2088"\w* the other.

¶ Yea, \w though|strong="H0432"\w* he \w live|strong="H2421"\w* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* \w twice|strong="H6471"\w* \add told\add*, yet hath he \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* no \w good|strong="H2896"\w*: do not all \w go|strong="H1980"\w* to \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w place|strong="H4725"\w*?

All the \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* of \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \add is\add* for his \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*, and yet the \w appetite|strong="H5315"\w* is not \w filled|strong="H4390"\w*.\f + \fr 6.7 \ft appetite: Heb. soul\f*

For what hath the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \w more|strong="H3148"\w* than the \w fool|strong="H3684"\w*? what hath the \w poor|strong="H6041"\w*, that \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* to \w walk|strong="H1980"\w* before the \w living|strong="H2416"\w*?

¶ \w Better|strong="H2896"\w* \add is\add* the \w sight|strong="H4758"\w* of the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* than the \w wandering|strong="H1980"\w* of the \w desire|strong="H5315"\w*: this \add is\add* also \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* and \w vexation|strong="H7469"\w* of \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*.\f + \fr 6.9 \ft than…: Heb. than the walking of the soul\f*

That which hath been is \w named|strong="H7121"\w* \w already|strong="H3528"\w*, and it is \w known|strong="H3045"\w* that it \add is\add* \w man|strong="H0120"\w*: neither \w may|strong="H3201"\w* he \w contend|strong="H1777"\w* with him that is \w mightier|strong="H8623"\w* than he.

¶ Seeing there \w be|strong="H3426"\w* \w many|strong="H7235"\w* \w things|strong="H1697"\w* that \w increase|strong="H7235"\w* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*, what \add is\add* \w man|strong="H0120"\w* the \w better|strong="H3148"\w*?

For who \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* what \add is\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* for \w man|strong="H0120"\w* in \add this\add* \w life|strong="H2416"\w*, \w all|strong="H4557"\w* the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w vain|strong="H1892"\w* \w life|strong="H2416"\w* which he \w spendeth|strong="H6213"\w* as a \w shadow|strong="H6738"\w*? for who can \w tell|strong="H5046"\w* a \w man|strong="H0120"\w* what shall be \w after|strong="H0310"\w* him under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*?\f + \fr 6.12 \ft all…: Heb. the number of the days of the life of his vanity\f*
